attributes.action: Protect the NE-Derbyshire parliamentry constituency from boundary changes.
attributes.background: There has been proposed boundary changes around the UK, one including my local constituency 'North East Derbyshire', it's been proposed that the constituency be scrapped but replaced with two new ones, which obviously doesn't make sense and is completely unnecessary.
attributes.additional_details:
The proposed boundary changes are in a sense 'undemocratic', local residents vote for a candidate to represent their constituency as their local MP, but changes are confusing local residents and angering some.

My source for this information is local media and other sources, I recommend googling about it, to find more information to prove this.

attributes.action: Stop the UK selling arms to any side of the Syrian conflict
attributes.background: The only way of ending the conflict in Syria is to stop supplying sides with arms. The UK government has a responsibility to ensure that any involvement in conflicts do not harm the citizens of that country or make the situation worse. Arming any side in Syria is prolonging the conflict.
attributes.additional_details: It is time to do what we can to help Syrian citizens and stop our involvement.

attributes.action: Create specialist knife crime units within the police.
attributes.background: In areas that have high levels of knife crime. Specialist knife crime units need to be created within the police, to tackle this ongoing issue.
attributes.additional_details: http://www.birminghammail.co.uk/news/midlands-news/black-october-knife-crime-after-12086384.amp

attributes.action: Legalise the possesion and use of tasers within the security industry.
attributes.background: In the security industry there are certain situations where security staff are unable protect themselves, Innocent bystanders, Assets. Due to individuals being agressive who cant be controlled by using conventional methods or a indavidual with a weapon, Bladed article or a possible firearm etc.
attributes.additional_details:
Each year there is numerous deaths and assaults within the security industry, Which could of been avoided with the use of a taser.

We understand that the use of a taser would be the very last resort. However we believe tasers would prevent such agression just by being a visual deterrent.
Monitoring tasers:
Anyone possesing a taser would need adequate training.
Body cameras to be used in conjuction with tasers to show taser was correctly drawn/used.

Police are the front line but so are we.

attributes.action: Make Armistice Day 2018 a national holiday
attributes.background: As the 11th of November 2018 will be the centenary of the end of the Great War (WW1) I believe as a make of respect the whole of the UK should have a national holiday to remember the fallen.

attributes.action: issue an apology  to homosexuals who were criminalised  under indecency laws
attributes.background: Lives have been ruined, aspirations destroyed by cruel laws , in the armed forces men were unjustly punished for the crime of falling in love with another man,blacklisted as sex offenders a status that for years hung like a shadow , causing pain ,hurt ,mental health issues and astricisation

attributes.action: To increase the age of a child's ticket, from 15 to 17, when traveling on trains
attributes.background: I am a 17 year old, and go to school in the city but live in the suburbs. Therefore I have to travel to school by train. The cost of an adult train fare is significantly more than a child's, considering I am just a child with no source of income, I think I have a right to pay child prices.

attributes.action: Make March 29th a public holiday to celebrate article 50 and Brexit.
attributes.background: Britain's exit from the European Union is a hugely significant political, social and economic event. It marks the start of a great new chapter in British history. As such, we should celebrate the triggering of article 50 to mark the start of this process.

attributes.action: Postpone changes to the DVSA ADI part 3 for more consultation and review
attributes.background: Currently anyone wishing to become a Driving Instructor will take three tests including the ADI part 3 instructional ability test.  In October 2017 there will be changes to the ADI part 3 which have the potential to lower the standards of driving instruction potentially endangering learner drivers.
attributes.additional_details:
The new proposed ADI part 3 will allow driving instructor trainees to structure the test in such a way that a pass will be easily achieved without a broad spectrum of knowledge and experiance that is currently required to pass the ADI part 3.

Whilst change is needed it is imperative that the test is reflective of the standards that are currently required.

attributes.action: Full pay leave for a minimum of 4 weeks for pregnancy loss prior to 24 weeks
attributes.background:
Currently pregnant women are forced to take statutory or company sick pay for pregnancy loss prior to 24 weeks gestation.
My little girl was still born at 23 weeks, which meant I had none of the same rights as I would had she of been born 1 week later, women are not given adequate time after loss
attributes.additional_details: I am requesting a change in legislation for loss of pregnancy prior to 24 weeks, so that women are able to heal physically & mentally with out financial hardship. This should be for an absolute minimum of 4 weeks and should be treated completely differently to normal sick pay.

attributes.action: Enable police to automatically seize bicycle when caught red light jumping.
attributes.background: Everyday, thousands of cyclist ignore red traffic lights. Little is done other than to provide small fine or "slap on the wrist", this clearly is not an effective deterrent. Allowing the police to automatic seize an offenders bicycle might make people thick twice.

attributes.action: Make Asthma Medication Available over the Counter at a Pharmacy
attributes.background: Being Asthmatic, its hard to judge when your medication will run out as some days you need more medication than others. If you run out you have to wait 48 hours form your GP to get a new prescription or please with a pharmacist to loan you one or sell you one. Asthmatics need direct access to meds.
attributes.additional_details: If you run out GP is closed and a pharmacist wont sell you one, you have two options, go to a walk in centre where they can treat you if you are having an attack, but not supply you with meds. Or you can go to hospital, where you will be warded, nebulised, be given a full examination and chest x ray and then be prescribed an inhaler. Making asthma medication available will save money for the NHS and let people breathe when they need to. Chemists will sell you Viagra but not an inhaler!

attributes.action: 65 and over to retake driving test or top up test
attributes.background:
The driving test now is near impossible.  Most failing at least once. 50 years ago the test was a completely different story, no theory test and nowhere near as strict. 
As well as a lack of road knowledge, unfortunately their age has a side effect on other road users causing traffic and accidents.

attributes.action: Release the 1921 Census records to the public now.
attributes.background: The latest Census records available to the public are way back in 1911. That's before the First World War. There are a lot of people trying to research their Family History but find it difficult with over 100 years gap on the National Census.
attributes.additional_details:
Signing this partition will help so many families to trace their roots  quicker and if we are successful the rule governing the release of Census records can be reduced from 100 years to 30.
Please check out this link and make up your mind 
http://www.abroadintheyard.com/access-1921-uk-census-now-30-arguments-for-against-early-release/

attributes.action: Resume the official testing of the male contraceptive injection
attributes.background: The male contraceptive injection testing was stopped because the side effects were too dangerous. However, the side effects that this contraceptive injection has are less dangerous than the side effects of  female contraceptives.
attributes.additional_details: We want men to volunteer to continue with the testing for this contraceptive injection. This is not a bash against men, but against the people who called off the testing.

attributes.action: Let council tenants rent to buy - Pay rent but own your home at the end of it
attributes.background: Help all people get on the property ladder and own their own rent-to-buy council tenants after one year of living in any council property

attributes.action: Do not change or abolish the House of Lords
attributes.background: All Brexit voters post Brexit have had a lot to say about abolishing the House of Lords because they dare do their job and hold the Government accountable when trying to pass a bill through. This is a vital part of our democracy and calls for the House of Lords to be abolished should be rejected.

attributes.action: Council tax banding needs updating
attributes.background: Council tax banding needs to reflect the current market. Many houses are worth more than a million and yet the banding has not been updated.
attributes.additional_details: With councils in debts as it is, higher valued properties I.e. 1 million, 2 million etc need additional banding beyond H. Please add more bands to pay for social care etc.

attributes.action: Plan a 70th Anniversary Festival of Britain as a Beacon for Change; post-Brexit.
attributes.background:
In 1951 the Festival of Britain celebrated British industry, arts and science and inspiring the thought of a better Britain during a period of turmoil and austerity.
In 2021 we can embrace the post-brexit change, remind ourselves and the rest of the world who we are and what we do as a nation.
attributes.additional_details:
The 1951 festival was a showcase of Britain’s finest architecture, technology, design, fashion, science, arts, manufacturing and creative industries to convince the nation during a period of austerity and turmoil that the future was not so bleak and that they were entering the age of modernity.

Historian Kenneth O. Morgan says the 1951 Festival was a "triumphant success". The Festival made a spectacular setting as a showpiece for the inventiveness and genius of British scientists and technologists.

For many similar reasons, we should do this again in 2021 following the Brexit divorce. This is also an opportunity to detract from the fractious negotiations of Brexit and unite behind a common goal over the next 4 years.

attributes.action: Create a 2nd EU referendum which allows for those between 16-17 to vote.
attributes.background: The youth of the UK will have to live with the result of Brexit longer than anyone else, despite most young people not wanting to leave the EU in the first place. Those between the ages of 16-17 should be recognised by parliament for such an important decision, rather than being disregarded.

attributes.action: Reduce UK overseas aid, release monies to NHS and local authorities
attributes.background: With immigration at an all time high, plus an ever aging population, it should not come as a surprise that local authorities and the NHS are struggling to cope. Monies currently earmarked for overseas aid should be spent at home, where charity is supposed to begin.

attributes.action: Tighten rules on companies that charge under 18s as if they were adult
attributes.background: It is unfair that we are not legally classed as an adult, so cannot vote, buy alcohol, be paid the adult minimum wage etc.. , but are expected to pay higher prices as if we were an adult , such as on buses, at cinemas, theme parks, airlines etc

attributes.action: Pensions for nurses Who have worked forty years and are over sixty
attributes.background:
Nurses over sixty are struggling to work in physically exhausting jobs.
We nursed in the seventies lifting heavy patients without hoists.
We used the Austrailian lift where we literally lifted the patient on our backs.
Long term hard physical and emotional nursing takes its toll.
attributes.additional_details:
Most of my friends are nurses, none of them have been able to keep going.
Let us have our state pension that we worked so hard for.
 I didn't expect to be in this position after forty five years of hard physical work I need dignity in retirement.

attributes.action: Scrap Stamp Duty
attributes.background:
Stamp duty makes it very difficult to buy a first home or even move home. 
The govement have schemes to help people get on the property ladder but then tax you if you do actually buy a home.

attributes.action: A deal between Australia and the UK for less restrictive working visas.
attributes.background: As a British Citizen currently living in Australia on a working holiday visa, I believe that the current visa limitations are detrimental for the two nations who would both profit from a more relaxed movement of labour between the the two nations. With Brexit looming this could fill a lost skill gap
attributes.additional_details: Currently obtaining a sponsorship to continue working in Australia is difficult and costly to obtain. Likewise for Australians trying to live and work in the U.K. It's costly and difficult. The commonwealth should be utilised more to benefit the citizens and the countries involved.

attributes.action: A referendum to stop HS2 & spend the money on more appropriate things.
attributes.background: The previous Labour Gov't and subsequent administrations are grandstanding to create a new railway, which will make the journey between London and Birmingham 20 minutes shorter. This will destroy so many pretty villages and people's homes & at present is estimated to cost between £50 & £80 billion.
attributes.additional_details: This is not the 19th century where our Victorian forbears really were innovative and had great reasons to build. They were investing in the great Industrial revolution for it to work then and there. The HS2 project will come to "fruition" in 30 years time and by that time, it is very possible it will be out of date. Businessmen can work on trains and often this journey is beneficial to a meeting. Cutting the journey time by 20 minutes is a false economy, whilst so many other projects need funds.

attributes.action: All new members of the House of Lords should sit for 10 years
attributes.background:
The present House of Lords has been a mockery for many many years.viz Iolanthe written in the 1800s. Major reform is unlikely. However my minor change would, in due time, reduce the numbers.
It should not be difficult to make this change.

attributes.action: New generation social housing policy
attributes.background: It is an issue close to many of our hearts that too many people are without affordable and safe accommodation. That as a country we are not doing enough to provide affordable housing, specialist housing units for under 25's, mother and baby units for our future generations.
attributes.additional_details:
We are campaigning for a new policy dictating:-

- Housing to be provided only to those with 10+ years in the UK
- New Decent Homes Standards
- Rent assessed on affordability with a baseline on each property
- Annual property reviews including tenancy and accommodation
- New Tenancy Groups which deal with localised property repair issues
- More specialised properties including low rent properties, young peoples living, over 50's & mother and baby units
- New Housing Officer Role & Training

attributes.action: Make it a requirement to teach healthy relationships in schools
attributes.background: i believe the teaching of healthy relationships in school will help to bring the level of domestic abuse down and teach children and young adults what is healthy and what is not and what they can do to protect themselves

attributes.action: Use our "special relationship" to persuade Trump to release his tax returns now.
attributes.background: The ordinary man has to pay tax, and has no choice in the matter. President Trump, as the leader of the free world, should set the example. He has claimed he paid millions in taxes, but has never proved it - Now he is president he should release his tax returns to back up his claims.

attributes.action: Make it a criminal offense to vote against, or block the result of a referendum.
attributes.background:
I find it utterly outrageous that there have been politcians in the goverment who have voted against the brexit referendum despite the people winning there right to freedom.

I propose all referendums are legally binding and to hinder,block or frustrate the process will become a criminal act.
attributes.additional_details: Politicians should brace democratic processes.

attributes.action: Add Welsh language education to the English school curriculum.
attributes.background: The Welsh language is spoken throughout both Wales and England and is arguably the native language of Great Britain, as well as 500,000 people. However, in England, the opportunity to learn Welsh is practically impossible.
attributes.additional_details: Give Welsh has an option in English schools to help promote cultural understand, give more people access to their ancestral language, help keep this magnificent language alive and create job opportunities for Welsh-speakers in England.

attributes.action: Accept 10,000 refugee families into the UK, instead of Donald Trump
attributes.background: Accept 10000 Vulnerable refugee families into the UK and settle them using the money That would be otherwise spent on Trumps state visit
attributes.additional_details: Accept 10,000 vulnerable refugee families with children into the uk, instead of having Donald Trump here for a state visit. The money we would spend on hosting Trump to be used to bring over / settle the refugee families into UK city's, help them to learn English and find jobs while accepting and embracing their culture

attributes.action: Stop penalising ex Veterens on their war pensions.
attributes.background: I want the government to stop penalising ex veterans who claim a war pension, but have to surrender most of it because they are out of work and claim benefits.

attributes.action: Stop local councils cutting low paid jobs without first cutting top salaries.
attributes.background: Recently, Newcastle City Council approved an £8500 pay rise for its chief executive despite assurances to the contrary. Many local council chief executives earn more than the Prime Minister and yet jobs lower down the pay scale are cut to save money.
attributes.additional_details: Dan O'Donaghue's article for the chronicle drew this issue to my attention. 30/1/17

attributes.action: Ban petitions calling for a ban on visits by heads of state invited by UK Govt
attributes.background: The media is full of 'news' on petitions calling for heads of states which have been invited by the UK Government to visit to be banned from visiting. This is a waste of resources and time, obviously the UK Govt has deemed it right that these people are invited in the first place.

attributes.action: Tax footy transfers >£1m to fund NHS nurses & require firms to sponsor a nurse
attributes.background: All football transfer to be taxed at vat rate go towards NHS nurses funding in whole of uk. Any firm over a set size would be required to fund a nurses salary and uniform - any additional nurse funding by the same firm could be in part allowable against tax.

attributes.action: Ensure that a trade deal with the EU is a priority over a trade deal with the US
attributes.background: The PM is discussing trade deals with the US, the party have given the impression that a trade deal with the US will be a substitute for the current trade deal with the European Union. Many jobs and business rely on the current EU trade deal and would gain no benefit from a trade deal with the USA.

attributes.action: Make the Mersey Gateway Bridge free to all Public Transport and Halton Residents
attributes.background: We have been told by George Osborne and David Cameron that we will have all inclusive travel via the Silver Jubilee bridge and the Mersey Gateway Bridge that  free of charge and not based on yearly admin fees which can be viewed as a subscription.
attributes.additional_details:
David Cameron came to vist o2 in Runcorn in2015 and he vouched the bridge would be free I heard this straight from the horses mouth and was also documented on North West Tonight.
link as follows from George Osbourne http://www.merseygateway.co.uk/2014/07/chancellor-of-the-exchequer-george-osborne-announces-free-trips-across-both-silver-jubilee-and-mersey-gateway-bridges-for-all-halton-residents/

attributes.action: Make all commuting via public transport tax-deductible.
attributes.background: Give Tax Relief to all commuters who use public transport to travel to and from their permanent place of work.  This would help reduce the cost of living to the average uk citizen and be better for the environment.
attributes.additional_details:
The employer buys the ticket and money is removed direct from the employees pay packet before tax is calculated. 
This may encourage less people to use cars which is better for the environment.  It can be managed online to reduce administration costs.

attributes.action: Stop High street shops keeping their doors open regardless of the weather.
attributes.background:
Make retail outlets keep their doors routinely closed when premises are heated to reduce the energy (heat) which is currently wasted.
This will reduce the impact on the environment and global warming by reducing as well as significantly reducing operating costs for retailers.
attributes.additional_details:
You would not leave your door open in all weathers at home.
 Legislation exists to improve energy efficiency in new buildings but High street retailers routinely keep external doors open simply as a marketing tool. Automatic door openers offer some benefit but these are often disabled simply to encourage shoppers to enter and buy. Legislation applying to all retailers will provide a level playing field and reduce any perceived marketing benefit which drives the current bad practice.

attributes.action: Make all injunctions free for those who are victims of domestic violence.
attributes.background:
My mum had been a victim of domestic violence for 20 years. A painful journey it had been. After finding the courage to leave she looked into implementing an injunction which was charged at £130 for each year. 
Victims are being left with an impossible choice save themselves or pay for the letter.
attributes.additional_details:
Injunction - An injunction is an equitable remedy in the form of a court order that compels a party to do or refrain from specific acts. A party that fails to comply with an injunction faces criminal or civil penalties, including possible monetary sanctions and even imprisonment. They can also be charged with contempt of court 

Wikipedia (2016) 'Injunction' available from https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Injunction

attributes.action: Make NHS must fund a life changing procedures for Gastroparesis patients.
attributes.background: My friend Nat 31 had a non-curable disease called Gastroparesis as well as EDS and P.O.T.S. for 8 years. Medication and feeding tubes have failed her and now the NHS are failing her with a simple hour procedure to have a pacemaker fitted to help regulate her stomach.
attributes.additional_details:
It costs the NHS more money to provide a bed, medication (which doesn't work) and feeding tubes which her body refuses. To have a Enterra stomach Pacemaker fitted costs privately between 10-20 thousand pounds. There is no comparison when someone's quality of life is at stake. 
 
Please please please help. Let's get this to parliament.

attributes.action: Make advertising in any form a fake job vacancy a serious offence
attributes.background: common practice within recruitment is to invent vacancies (even in some cases naming a real Company) to increase the number of CV's a recruitment agency has on file.  This completely wastes job-seekers time, effort, gives them false hope and distracts them from the real task of getting a job

attributes.action: 2017 to be the year that the UK start protecting native wildlife In our cities.
attributes.background: Our wildlife is losing it's natural habitat & struggling to adjust to our cities.In this unknown future in the UK due to Brexit.I ask you to firstly pledge your assurance to keep EU laws on our enviroment.Secondly, a guarantee that the goverment will help make our cities accessible to wildlife.
attributes.additional_details: This is important for our wildlife in the UK.In Milan over 800 trees have been planted on rooftops & balconies resulting in species abundance growth.This could be achieved in the UK with help from university students of Enviromental sciences.This cuts costs &helps students develop skills& portfolios,which could lead to job growth.If achieved,this could attract tourists to cities throughout the UK& boost our economy.There is no doubt that our wildlife,worldwide is depleting at a dangerous rate.

attributes.action: Cancel the Sugar Tax
attributes.background: The government is introducing the Sugar Tax a.k.a the Soft Drinks Industry Levy in 2018 and this means that soft drinks will either lose some of their good taste due to lower sugar levels or become more expensive as a result of the drink companies passing on the cost of the tax to their customers.
attributes.additional_details: I believe that this tax is an assault on freedom of choice and another example of a nanny state and I call upon the government and parliament to stop its implementation.

attributes.action: The UK should follow Sweden, cut VAT for fixing goods rather than throwing away.
attributes.background: To combat its ‘throwaway consumer culture’, Sweden has announced tax breaks on repairs to clothes, bicycles, fridges and washing machines. Repairs are more labour-intense than production, which is largely automised, repairs actually contribute to an expanding labour market decreasing unemployment.
attributes.additional_details:
Jobs would be in the U.K. not abroad, they would be where you live & benefit the local economy.  Whereas large-scale manufacturing is very centralised. This will expand the number of companies giving these kinds of services so It’ll be easier for consumers to have things repaired.

It will be easier for people to buy high-quality products because they know it’s affordable to have them fixed if something breaks, giving an  incentive not to buy as cheap as possible and then scrap something.

attributes.action: Make it illegal to breed dogs without being a registered breeder
attributes.background: It should be illegal to breed dogs unless you are a breeder registered on some sort of national register in order to stop people breeding dogs for the wrong reasons and purely for financial gain. It would also help prevent the horrific treatment and breeding in these 'puppy farms'
attributes.additional_details: A national register of breeders should be produced with them all being regulated my a body of animal welfare officers. Anyone breeding outside of these registers should be prosecuted and liable to an unlimited fine.

attributes.action: Increase the mental health budget now.
attributes.background: It's a serious issue and affects people’s physical health and the economy. Better prevention measures – access to therapies and support, faster referrals, more time to discuss with a GP versed in mental health – means better outcomes overall. We value mental health and the budget must reflect it!
attributes.additional_details: December 2016: Less and less being spent on mental health: Local authorities use less than 1% of their budget on services

attributes.action: Cyclists should complete a road safety test and pay for insurance and road tax.
attributes.background: Over the last few years there has been a increase in road accidents involving cyclists. Some accidents happen through a complete lack of road sense. It is dangerous to the cyclists and especially to drivers on the road. Cyclists should also pay for road tax and be insured if they are using the road.
